title: Rotational kinematics same position double speed

content.question: An object is rotating with an angular position described by the equation <math alttext="theta equals A plus B t plus C t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>B</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, where <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>C</mi></math> are positive constants with appropriate units. Which of the following equations would represent the angular position of a different object with the same initial angular position and rotating at twice the angular velocity at all times?

choices.label: <math alttext="theta equals A plus B t plus 2 C t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>B</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>C</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="theta equals A plus 2 B t plus C t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>B</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>C</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="theta equals A plus 2 B t plus 2 C t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>B</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>C</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="theta equals 2 A plus 2 B t plus 2 C t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>A</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>B</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>C</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="theta equals A plus 2 B t plus 2 C t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>B</mi><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>C</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
